sentences.english: Many disaster will happen every day in the world.
sentences.chinese: 在這個世界上，天天都邑發生很多災難性的工作。

sentences.english: The Chinese people faced this disaster with compassion and courage.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民用愛心和勇氣來面對這場災難。

sentences.english: There are uncountable examples of how the bandage of love brings us catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 談到愛的纏裹帶給我們的災難，更是俯拾即是。

sentences.english: Nearly 3 weeks of continuous heavy rains and floods in eastern Australia, calamity-ridden.
sentences.chinese: 連續近3周的暴雨和洪水使澳大利亞東部災難深重。

sentences.english: The economic development that the bank helped spur has unleashed a wave of environmental woes.
sentences.chinese: 亞銀協助亞洲經濟快速發展，引爆一波環保災難。

sentences.english: Parents should also acknowledge the frightening parts of the disaster when talking with a child about it.
sentences.chinese: 與孩子談話時，家長應清楚災難的可怕之處在哪裏。

sentences.english: The figure on the right side is a mirror-image of the left side and is used for disaster recovery purposes.
sentences.chinese: 右側圖片是左側圖片的鏡像，用於災難恢復。

sentences.english: Great supplies were sent to the disaster-hit area.
sentences.chinese: 大量的給養被運送到遭受災難襲擊的地區。

sentences.english: Disasters may come straight to you , but happiness often comes in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 災難可能是徑直走到面前，可是幸福總是化妝潛來。

sentences.english: Too often they have unintended consequences, helping to create the next disaster.
sentences.chinese: 它們常常帶來意想不到的結果，可能產生下一場災難。

sentences.english: I think animals can sense disaster.They have a sixth sense.
sentences.chinese: 我想動物通常能感知大災難的來臨，它們有第六感。

sentences.english: However, when the snow continued to the South Sala , has become a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 然而當雪花持續不斷撒落到南方時，卻成了一種災難。

sentences.english: The economic disaster will cause an ecological disaster.
sentences.chinese: 經濟災難將導致生態災難。

sentences.english: The economic disaster will cause an ecological disaster.
sentences.chinese: 經濟災難將導致生態災難。

sentences.english: Contemporary society, people have produced the serious self-contradiction.
sentences.chinese: 當代社會人的自我矛盾甚至自我分裂已是災難性問題。

definition: to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to happen/to occur/to take place/to break out
